update.description:
Add the checkpoint to plug the cable onto the solar panel.

* I tried a different approach here and instead of writing a model plugin, I wrote the logic directly into the Task implementation
* This is similar to `TouchPlugin` , but after contact has been held for a while, a fixed joint between the plug and the outlet is created.
* Added a dedicated cylindrical collision for the outlet onto the solar panel.
    ![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/933378933-t2cp5_2.png)
* Contact is stable between the plug and the outlet and I was able to plug it in teleoperating Val:
    ![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/1120564973-t2cp5.png)
* Because of the contact parameters, the cable enters the outlet, which in the end I think is a cool effect:
    ![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3688958305-t2cp5_3.png)

## How to test it

1. Skip to this checkpoint
2. Find a way to drop the cable plug right on top of the outlet
3. The moment they touch, you'll see:
    `[Msg] Plug started touching outlet at 251 520000000 seconds` 
4. After they are touching continuously for 5 seconds, you'll see:

        [Msg] The cable plug has been fixed to the outlet
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [5] - Completed (256 521000000)
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [6] - Started (256 521000000)
        [Msg] Started box contains plugin [task2/checkpoint6]
update.title: Task 2 Checkpoint 5

content.raw: I haven't tried running it yet but the patch looks good on a first look. I just added two minor comments as early feedback.
content.html: I haven't tried running it yet but the patch looks good on a first look. I just added two minor comments as early feedback.

content.raw: Since the case `!touching` is checked above and returns early this condition doesn't need `touching`.
content.html: Since the case !touching is checked above and returns early this condition doesn't need touching.

content.raw: If it is possible that the sensor is not casted successfully this line should be wrapped in a check if the pointer is valid. Otherwise segfault.
content.html: If it is possible that the sensor is not casted successfully this line should be wrapped in a check if the pointer is valid. Otherwise segfault.

update.description:
Add the checkpoint to plug the cable onto the solar panel.

* I tried a different approach here and instead of writing a model plugin, I wrote the logic directly into the Task implementation
* This is similar to `TouchPlugin` , but after contact has been held for a while, a fixed joint between the plug and the outlet is created.
* Added a dedicated cylindrical collision for the outlet onto the solar panel.

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/933378933-t2cp5_2.png)

* Contact is stable between the plug and the outlet and I was able to plug it in teleoperating Val:

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/1120564973-t2cp5.png)

* Because of the contact parameters, the cable enters the outlet, which in the end I think is a cool effect:

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3688958305-t2cp5_3.png)

## How to test it

1. Skip to this checkpoint
2. Find a way to drop the cable plug right on top of the outlet
3. The moment they touch, you'll see:
    1. `[Msg] Plug started touching outlet at 251 520000000 seconds` 
4. After they are touching continuously for 5 seconds, you'll see:

    [Msg] The cable plug has been fixed to the outlet
    [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [5] - Completed (256 521000000)
    [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [6] - Started (256 521000000)
    [Msg] Started box contains plugin [task2/checkpoint6]
update.title: Task 2 Checkpoint 5
